page.title: 10Bickleigh/Wotter housing
page.content: The core of Bickleigh village consists of turn of the century workmen's houses built by Sir Massey Lopes. They are characterised by small gabled upstairs windows and a stone with ML and date in each front wall. A few modern houses have been added and the out-buildings of a farm are being converted into dwellings. Bickleigh camo buildings are are square modern "barracks architecture". In Wotter 50% of the houses were built by the china clay company which still owns and maintains them.There are a few private dwellings, the rest are dull council houses.The farms are much older than the villages.Three of them date from the 14th century and belonged originally to Plympton Priory.They have been modernised but retain many orioginal features eg dove holes at Lower Collard Farm.
